page.title: 01PORTHCAWL-Shopping Area
page.content: PORTHCAWL-Shopping,Fair,Caravans The section of Porthcawl in this rectangle covers the old and the new of the area,although Porthcawl is not a very old town,most of it has only been in existence since the middle of the last century.It contains the main shopping area,the largest hotels,the Grand Pavillion,the old harbour,the fair,several of the sandy beaches,and a large section of one of the largest caravan sites in Europe. The town grew with the building of a harbour serving the rich coal seams of the Maesteg,Ogmore,and Garw Valleys Since this harbour closed,early this century,Porthcawl has become one of the most popular and attractive tourist areas in South Wales,serving the industrial valleys once more.
